column4: you know what's really missing is a guide on how to use random software
people don't realize you can just type 'theme' in a box :p
indeed
the problem is not that i dont know to type theme inot the serach box, the probem is i have 2000 results that are not themes
for example?
none of the themes listed in the chat show up,
heh, k
theme packages probably follow a naming convention
foo-theme-bar, or the like
they should be all grouped together
you could get at them quicker from a terminal: apt-cache search theme | grep -i gnome, etc.
there is something wrong with the serach, for example if i search for theme nothing shows up related to themes, if i search for adium then the audium-theme shows up
maybe you're searching by description and not name
or vice versa
again apt-cache search in a terminal is going to be faster/easier to parse
yes, for you and i, however for someone else thats not very good at the terminal, not its not.  I am just wondering why one the software center doesnt search pacakge names
install synaptic
software center is the super dumbed down version
awesome!! thats just what i was looking for.  Thanks!
